description: This function extracts and processes 'message/rfc822' attachments from an email. It stores these attachments in a vault and generates artifacts containing the corresponding vault IDs and file names. This capability is essential for extracting attached emails, file attachments, and ensuring that critical email data is accurately stored and referenced for future use.

inputs.description: The ID of the vault containing the email.
inputs.name: vault_id

inputs.description: The identifier of the container to which the artifacts will be added.
inputs.name: container_id

inputs.description: The name of the new artifact. This parameter is optional and defaults to "Vault Artifact".
inputs.name: name

inputs.description: The label assigned to the new artifact. This parameter is optional and defaults to "artifact".
inputs.name: label

inputs.description: The severity level of the new artifact. This parameter is optional and defaults to "Medium". Acceptable values are "High", "Medium", or "Low".
inputs.name: severity

inputs.description: A boolean value ("true" or "false") indicating whether the new artifact should trigger the execution of any active playbooks associated with the container label. This parameter is optional and defaults to "false".
inputs.name: run_automation

inputs.description: A boolean value ("true" or "false") indicating whether to extract 'message/rfc822' attachments. This parameter is optional and defaults to "true".
inputs.name: extract_rfc822

inputs.description: A boolean value ("true" or "false") indicates whether to extract other types of attachments. This parameter is optional and defaults to "true".
inputs.name: extract_other_attachments

outputs.description: The unique identifier for the newly created vault item. Each new_vault_id corresponds to an attachment extracted from the email and stored in the vault.
